attributes.comment:
Please reconsider the proposed adjustments to the USCIS fee schedule.
Immigrants paying these fees are law-abiding individuals who pay taxes,
contribute to their communities, and are learning English. We all benefit from
increases in legal immigration and citizenship ? economically and culturally.
Immigrants should be encouraged, not hindered from applying for legal status.
The new fees are not just an added expense, but would prohibit even those
making a middle class income from being able to afford permanent residence or
citizenship for their families.

I understand that USCIS is seeking the fee increases to ensure appropriate
funding to meet national security requirements and customer service needs, and
to modernize an outdated business infrastructure. While I agree that service
quality should be improved to eliminate the backlog and remedy misplaced cases,
I do not believe that thisis the best way to accomplish those goals. Nor do I think
that legal immigrants should be forced to bear this burden. Such large marginal
increases are unprecedented, unnecessary and detrimental to the pursuit of the
American dream. I urge you to find other ways to more efficiently use your current
budget and to raise funds for technology needs.

I have written to my Senators and Congressman urging them to support proposed
Senate and House measures that would prevent the fee increases from taking
effect and I urge others to do the same.

Thank you.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Erica R. Spohr, Lutheran Social Services of Michigan
